metadata.title: CVE-2024-45019 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/mlx5e: Take state lock during tx timeout reportermlx5e_safe_reopen_channels() requires the state lock taken. Thereferenced changed in the Fixes tag removed the lock to fix anotherissue. This patch adds it back but at a later point (when callingmlx5e_safe_reopen_channels()) to avoid the deadlock referenced in theFixes tag.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-45019` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
